commit.message: Correct definition of stub CLOSE macro

Fix undefined behaviour in Rust examples.

This addresses bug https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/471
"Examples in re2rust manual have undefined behavior".

In Rust, it is UB to call `get_unchecked` on a slice that may be empty,
and many examples had functions that did just that (when invoked on
incorrect input data, since they use some form of sentinel method to
handle the end of input, which relies on the input being sentinel-
terminated).

The introductory example has been fixed to avoid UB and use simple
indexing with bounds checks instead of `get_unchecked`. Other examples
that had UB are now annotated with `assert` that checks conditions under
which the functions are safe to invoke.

Also, eof/02_bounds_checks.re example now uses a more efficient way to
construct YYMAXFILL-padded input string.
IDEAS.md: fix typo s/inforamtion/information/

[bazel] Fix _re2c_impl

Mainly `[err_file]` is an undefined variable.

Probably some tl&c would be worth it, converting to bazel module,
but that's for another day.

.github/workflows/ci-cmake.yml: avoid `pwd` and use `${{ github.workspace }}`

It loks like at least in `windows` `actions/upload-artifact@v4` CI step
fails to collect files at `${{ steps.build-info.outputs.BUILD_DIR }}/test_[0-9]*`

My theory is that `glob` is not able to match paths like

    `D:/a/re2c/re2c/install-2`

against theit unix-like form of

    `/d/a/re2c/re2c/install-2`

I suspect that `pwd` returns us the second form while
`${{ github.workspace }}` might keep an original form.
GitHub Actions: update versions of dependency actions.
.github/dependabot.yml: add basic plumbing to auto-update used actions

Rewrite lexer of string/char literals in code blocks.

Lex char literals properly as single characters or escape sequences
rather than lexing them as single-quoted strings. Add syntax rules from
C/C++, Go and Rust (they are similar and do not contradict).

Add a Go test for string and character literals (prior to this patch it
caused a syntax error).

Note that the same lexer method is used for indented code blocks and
code blocks in curly braces.

Wrap lexer body in braces only if there're local variable declarations.

This is a revert of commit 77714fce9463abfe4420af93e27bb8ac4c24719c.

While it is easier to always generate braces, in some languages (Go) it
is a compilation error to jump into the wrapped block (a scenario that
happens if there is an outer state switch generated with `getstate:re2c`
directive.

This regression was found because one of the examples for Go didn't
compile (examples/state/push.go). Now it does.
release.sh: check that examples work.
CMake: set C++17 standard for benchmarks that use re2.

CMakeLists.txt: make C++11 standard required (not optional).

This fixes https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/455 "Test for C++11
compiler at configure time".

configure.ac: make C++ compiler flag -std=c++11 required (not optional).

This fixes https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/455 "Test for C++11
compiler at configure time".

Makefile.am: add missing files to distribution.

This fixes https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/454 "BUILD.md not
present in tarball".

BUILD.md: document C++11 requirement.

This fixes https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/453 "Document C++11
compiler requirement in BUILD.md".
Release 3.1.
release.sh: make the script NixOS-friendly, fix quoting in echo command.
Makefile.lib.am: remove nonexistent header from the list.
Update CHANGELOG.
Document configure option --enable-parsers in BUILD.md.

Update documentation for capturing and non-capturing groups.

Document the following options:
    --leftomost-captures
    --invert-captures

And the following configurations:
    re2c:leftmost-captures
    re2c:invert-captures

And the new `(! ...)` syntax.
Add tests for `re2c:leftmost-captures` and `re2c:posix-captures`.

Add configuration `re2c:leftmost-captures`.

It has the same meaning as the --leftmost-captures option.

Fix build scripts for Wine to run on NixOS.

Wine cannot find DLLs by their absolute paths on NixOS, so find and copy
them before running re2c.exe.
Add missing header include to make src/codegen/code.h self-contained.

Replace `enum GorPass` with uint32_t as it is used in a bitfield.

It cannot be a `enum class` because it's used in a bitfield and this
triggers compiler warnings and errors on some toolchains (see
https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/issues/446 for details).

It cannot be a plain `enum` defaulting to `int` as well because of
-Wsigned-enum-bitfield warning (noticed when testing on OpenBSD with
clang-13).
Make function `static` as it is used in one file.

Drop _POSIX_SOURCE, enable -std=gnu++11 for CMake.

On Unix systems, re2c uses POSIX functions (e.g. fdopen). Certain
systems, such as Cygwin and NetBSD, enable these funtions conditionally
based on certain preprocessor definitions.

Previously https://github.com/skvadrik/re2c/pull/376 fixed the build on
Cygwin by setting _POSIX_SOURCE. However, this broke the build on
FreeBSD which was fixed by commit

This worked for Autotools build system which uses -std=c++11 due to the
use of AC_USE_SYSTEM_EXTENSIONS, but it didn't work for CMake that used
-std=c++11 and disabled extensions with `set(CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS OFF)`.

This commit drops `set(CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS OFF)`, which effectively
enables -std=gnu++11 instead of -std=c++11 for CMake builds. This allows
us to get rid of the problematic _POSIX_SOURCE that breaks the build on
NetBSD.

This was tested on NetBSD-9.3, FreeBSD-13.2 and Cygwin with both
Autotools and CMake.

libre2c: omit redundant semicolon after namespace.

This gets rid of compiler warnings on some older toolchains (e.g. GCC-10
emits pedantic diagnostic about it, which was fixed in
https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=96068).

Omit redundant semicolon after namespace.

This gets rid of compiler warnings on some older toolchains (e.g. GCC-10
emits pedantic diagnostic about it, which was fixed in
https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=96068).
